required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Wisconsin Department of Health and Family Services
National Institute of Nutrition and Seafood Research, Norway

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the project is to investigate whether an intervention program with vitamin D supplementation is able to improve the biology of stress resilience as well as subjective well-being in individuals with antisocial behavior problems (forensic inpatients).

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized control trial looking at the effects of vitamin D supplements on mental health in a group of forensic inpatients. More specific the effects of vitamin D will be investigated in relation to underlying biological mechanisms associated with resilience (e.g., serotonin, cortisol, heart rate variability and executive functioning), but also subjective well-being such as sleep quality, emotion-regulation, anxiety, depression and self-reported resilience. About 100 participants will be randomized to an intervention group (vitamin D) or a control group (placebo). The intervention will last for 3-4 months. Pre-test will start in October/November 2017 and post-test in April/May 2018.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in vitamin D level in blood from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time for blood sample: about 10-15 minutes (at both pre and post test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in serotonin from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time for blood sample: about 10-15 minutes (at both pre and post test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in total cholesterol from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time for blood sample: about 10-15 minutes (at both pre and post test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in lipoproteins from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time for blood sample: about 10-15 minutes (at both pre and post test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in triglycerides from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time for blood sample: about 10-15 minutes (at both pre and post-test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cortisol from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 samples over 24 hours (at both pre and post-test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in performance on working memory tasks (N-back) from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: About 8-10 minutes (at both pre and post-test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in performance on Tower of Hanoi Task from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: About 10-15 minutes (at bot pre and post-test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in performance on Tower of London Task from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: About 10-15 minutes (at both pre and post test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in performance on Iowa Gambling Task from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: About 15-20 minutes (at both pre and post test)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in heart rate variability from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 5 minutes of baseline, during the cognitive testing (up to 60 minutes) and 5 minutes of recovery (at both pre and post test)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in sleep from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One week before intervention and one week after intervention (i.e., pre and post-test)
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by Ambulatory Monitoring System together with a sleep log

secondary_outcome.measure: Change on Epworth Sleepiness Scale from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: About 5-10 minutes (at both pre and post-test)
The physical activity log will be filled out weekly over the course of the study period (i.e., 24 -28 weeks) and estimated time per week is 10 minutes.
secondary_outcome.description: The log consists of weekly recording of various activity levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported state and trait anxiety (STAI questionnaire) from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: About 10 minutes (at both pre and post-test)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported resilience (Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale 25) from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: About 5 minutes (at both pre and post-test)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in post-traumatic stress symptoms (Impact of event scale -Revised) from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: About 5-10 minutes (at both pre and post-test)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in self-reported depression (Beck Depression Inventory) from pre-test (baseline) to post-test (after 4 months)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: About 5-10 minutes (at both pre and post-test)

intervention.description: Vitamin D (40µg/day) will be compared with placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with intelligence quotient > 70 will be invited.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with intelligence quotient <70 will be excluded.
- Patients already taking vitamin D.
- Patients with psychotic disorders.
